Read my 8 Principles on the Iran nuclear negotiations.http://www.wsj.com/articles/much-more-is-needed-to-stop-iran-from-getting-the-bomb-1431899619 …
#8. Certification by the president Iran changed its aggressive behavior & no longer qualifies as a designated state sponsor of terrorism.
#7. Removal of all enriched uranium from Iran. No need for Iran to possess a large stockpile of low enriched or any highly enriched uranium.
#6. Iran must NOT be allowed to conduct research and development on advanced centrifuges.
#5. There must be an explicit process for the 'snapback' re-imposition of sanctions if Iran violates the deal.
#4. Sanctions relief/access to funds be phased in & fully conditioned on IAEA certification Iran in full & sustained compliance.
#3.  Anytime, anywhere inspections of all Iranian military and nonmilitary facilities.
#2. Closure of all hardened and formerly secret sites. Iran must come clean on all outstanding issues raised by the IAEA.
#1. Iran must not be allowed an enrichment capability greater than the practical needs to supply one commercial reactor.
My 8 Principles to ensure we get the right answers and achieve a sound, enforceable deal regarding Iran's nuclear program.

We hardly address the future growth of entitlements, a major contributor of future budgetary problems.
The only part of our nation’s budget which is really exposed to serious consequences under this compromise is the Department of Defense.
And these deep cuts would come at a time when threats to our nation are increasing, not declining.
If fully implemented, the consequences to our nation’s defense infrastructure would be severe.
This agreement adds over $7 trillion in new debt over the next decade and only makes small reductions in future spending.
It locks us into more debt, bigger government and most devastating of all, a weakened defense infrast're at a time we face growing threats.
I cannot in good conscience support this deal.
